part.Name: Description
part.Short: =pronouns.Possessive= hunched back is rippling with fungal growth. The nose at the end of =pronouns.possessive= bear-snout is wet and cracked. Long, slender, triple-jointed fingers sprout from =pronouns.possessive= pudgey paws and press against =pronouns.possessive= core in painful composure.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Bay gills tense and release, tense and release, tense and release, as if drawing breath into the puffer's stem. With each exhalation it belches a cloud of copper spores like motes of dusk. They flutter back to the cap and congeal into a dull plasma.

part.Name: QuestStepFinisher
part.Step: Determine the Fate of the the Barathrumite Expedition

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Fungi puppeteers expired flesh without remembrance of its host's base form, a non-neural mockery of life. Ascomata extend a shumbling gait forward: gone are the shiny teeth, the hispid skin, the spheric hooves.
